bug.author: 2er0
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Issue Summary</denchmark-h>
Unable to fetch/download models <denchmark-h:h3>Executed Command (if any)</denchmark-h>
models\getModels.bat <denchmark-h:h3>OpenPose Output (if any)</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16341653/84037307-aff1ae80-a99e-11ea-8bcd-066a190296be.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Type of Issue</denchmark-h>
Compilation/installation error Execution error
<denchmark-h:h3>Your System Configuration</denchmark-h>
OpenPose version: 1.6.0 & 1.5.1 - maybe more - not testet
If Windows system:
Portable demo

comments.comment: I experience similar problem, as the BAT file generates many 503 warnings. Unable to download the model is there an alternative?

Same here, I am unable to reach the website. I get the following: <denchmark-link:https://camo.githubusercontent.com/513cde4d2e05ff68e8eee04033c6ced9795c5a38653b5d98ec0d174a9425c077/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f524c48484e59512e706e67></denchmark-link>

We are trying to get it back up, but due to COVID, we are waiting for CMU to grant access so we can officially enter the actual room where the server is to fix it. We will keep you updated. Sorry for the troubles.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gineshidalgo99>@gineshidalgo99</denchmark-link> If someone has a local copy of the files downloaded from the server, can they share it somewhere so that we can keep the work going on till you guys fix this?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gineshidalgo99>@gineshidalgo99</denchmark-link> Any estimate on how long it might be before the server is restored/an alternate download is available? Appreciate the help

I was able to finally copy the data out of the servers (although they have fallen again), so this is the temporary workaround until I replace all OpenPose links for Dropbox or G. Drive ones: Download these 2 links (either G Driver or Dropbox): G Drive version: <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mqPEnqCk5bLMZ3XnfvxA4Dao7pj0TErr/view?usp=sharing>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mqPEnqCk5bLMZ3XnfvxA4Dao7pj0TErr/view?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QCSxJZpnWvM00hx49CJ2zky7PWGzpcEh/view?usp=sharing>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QCSxJZpnWvM00hx49CJ2zky7PWGzpcEh/view?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
Dropbox version: <denchmark-link:https://www.dropbox.com/s/gpwg0tbsimo0fr5/models.zip>https://www.dropbox.com/s/gpwg0tbsimo0fr5/models.zip</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.dropbox.com/s/1kfh7lqb9ptqj0l/3rdparty.zip>https://www.dropbox.com/s/1kfh7lqb9ptqj0l/3rdparty.zip</denchmark-link>
And unzip them and copy in the right place the required files. To know where each file goes, follow: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/CMU-Perceptual-Computing-Lab/openpose/blob/master/doc/prerequisites.md>https://github.com/CMU-Perceptual-Computing-Lab/openpose/blob/master/doc/prerequisites.md</denchmark-link> (if you are not using the latest OpenPose version, then follow the names used in whatever doc/prerequisites.md file you have!) Sorry for the troubles!!!
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gineshidalgo99>@gineshidalgo99</denchmark-link> Thank you for the quick action, however, those links are down, cannot be found.

I can't believe it, the stupid Dropbox blocked them in a few hours: "Your Dropbox public links have been suspended for generating excessive traffic". I am uploading them to G Drive, should be ready in 1-2 h, i'll update this post then

I was able to finally copy the data out of the servers (although they have fallen again), so this is the temporary workaround until I replace all OpenPose links for Dropbox or G. Drive ones: Download these 2 links (either G Driver or Dropbox): G Drive version: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mqPEnqCk5bLMZ3XnfvxA4Dao7pj0TErr/view?usp=sharing https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QCSxJZpnWvM00hx49CJ2zky7PWGzpcEh/view?usp=sharing
How can we make use of these links if we are using OpenPose on Google Colab?

still the same error? getModels.sh returns 502. I'm using G Drive link below:
I was able to finally copy the data out of the servers (although they have fallen again), so this is the temporary workaround until I replace all OpenPose links for Dropbox or G. Drive ones: Download these 2 links (either G Driver or Dropbox): G Drive version: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mqPEnqCk5bLMZ3XnfvxA4Dao7pj0TErr/view?usp=sharing https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QCSxJZpnWvM00hx49CJ2zky7PWGzpcEh/view?usp=sharing Dropbox version: https://www.dropbox.com/s/gpwg0tbsimo0fr5/models.zip https://www.dropbox.com/s/1kfh7lqb9ptqj0l/3rdparty.zip And unzip them and copy in the right place the required files. To know where each file goes, follow: https://github.com/CMU-Perceptual-Computing-Lab/openpose/blob/master/doc/prerequisites.md (if you are not using the latest OpenPose version, then follow the names used in whatever doc/prerequisites.md file you have!) Sorry for the troubles!!!
